results.title: Stop the drop: a concert for nuclear disarmament
results.brief_description: Footage from a benefit rock concert for the anti-uranium movement is shown and is combined with interviews with the performers of the concert. The concert was held at the Sidney Myer Music Bowl in Melbourne and the performers included bands such as “Goanna”, “Midnight Oil” “INXS”, “Men at work” and “Redgum”.

results.title: Stop the Bulldozer
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Architecture at the Crossroads Series”.
Part Seven of a series which examines the main themes in world architecture today. The series looks at the work of architects who are at the centre of the current debate, and introduces some younger architects who are beginning to make a name for themselves. All over the world people are fighting the tendency to destroy the old. Stations are being turned into museums, factories into concert halls. Everywhere old buildings have been given new life. Part Seven looks at the reconstruction of the historic centre of Frankfurt, the new museum in Paris and the revitalised shopping malls of America.

results.title: Stop talking and do something
results.creator_credit: Jan Sharp, Janet Isaac and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Priority Schools”.
A group of teachers in the Sydney suburb of Marrickville discuss the problems they, their students and the students’ families encounter in such an area. These include unemployment, low income, lack of interest in school and cultural differences.

results.title: Stop or go: an experiment in genetics
results.creator_credit: National Educational Television and Bert Shapiro
results.brief_description: A documentation of an experiment which successfully analysed the genetic code of a mutant virus. Dr Norton Zinder and his colleagues at Rockefeller University, New York City, are shown as they separate the mutant viruses from non-mutants, grow new generations of the mutants, extract the mutants’ genetic materials, and test whether or not this material will manufacture a certain protein known as the coat protein.

results.title: Stop laughing, this is serious
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and John Power
results.brief_description: A survey of the Australian newspaper cartoon tradition from the 1880’s up to the late 1960’s. Shows many examples of Australian artists’ work, some of which are famous throughout the world. Today’s cartoonists: Emile Mercier, George Molnar, Bruce Petty and Les Tanner discuss their work, struggles and aspirations. Narrated by Frank Legg, music by Don Burrows.

results.title: Stop It Burning
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Portable fire extinguishers are the frontline of defence for most fires in the workplace. A knowledge of what types of fire extinguishers to use on what fires is important for everyone. This video looks at the extinguishing agents, shows the correct procedure for checking an extinguisher and details the differences in the application and methods of using the different types of extinguishers.

results.title: Stop forest fires
results.creator_credit: United States. Forest Service and Raymond Evans
results.brief_description: In its appeal to everyone to take special precautions with fires, cigarettes, cigarette lighters, and matches, in forest areas,. this American film shows the shocking damage wrought by forest fires in the USA to forest lands, wild life, live stock, soil and homes. Narrated by Alois Havrillon.
